definition: natural person (law)/see also 法人[fa3 ren2]

sentences.english: Therefore the nature of technology is one kind of tool which personalizes essence.
sentences.chinese: 所以技術的本質就是一種把自在自然人化的工具。

sentences.english: Natural persons and economic organizations without legal personality shall not undertake the production of alcoholic drinks.
sentences.chinese: 自然人和非法人經濟組織不得從事酒類生產。

sentences.english: Three, Expanding the body of the abandonment crime, which including natural person and unit.
sentences.chinese: 擴大遺棄罪主體，犯罪主體包括自然人和單位。

sentences.english: A natural person may only make investment for the incorporation of one one-person company with limited liability.
sentences.chinese: 一個自然人只能投資設立一個一人有限責任公司。

sentences.english: The capacity for civil liability has nothing to do with the capacity for civil conduct.
sentences.chinese: 一切自然人都具有民事權利能力和民事責任能力。

sentences.english: Theapplicant must be a natural person with an impeccable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 申請人必須是擁有良好聲譽的自然人。

sentences.english: Right to birth belongs to human rights, enjoying by a separate man or woman.
sentences.chinese: 生育權爲人身權，由單個自然人享有。

sentences.english: Self help - A term sometimes used to describe when a person handles a legal matter on their own, without using a lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 自然人不借助律師的幫助，自己處理法律問題。

sentences.english: Individual violators could face up to 15 days in prison and a small fine.
sentences.chinese: 自然人違反該法將會面臨15天的拘留和小額的罰款。

sentences.english: The legal capacity of a human being begins on the completion of birth.
sentences.chinese: 自然人之權利能力，始於出生完成。

definition: legal person/corporation/see also 自然人[zi4 ran2 ren2]
(law) legal representative of a corporation (e.g. chairman of the board of a company, principal of a school etc)
to be qualified (to bring a complaint, lawsuit etc) (law)
